medical_history.chief_complaint: Congenital hypothyroidism and choreoathetosis without respiratory distress.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: In case 1, symptoms were evident with TSH of 186.2 mU/liter and T4 of 6.5 µg/dl at postnatal day 18, with motor skill delay at 15 months. In case 2, symptoms emerged with TSH of 65.0 mU/liter and T4 of 9.7 µg/dl at postnatal day 17, along with similar psychomotor issues.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Mild hypothyroidism in both sisters; transient hypothyroidism in the mother during both pregnancies.
medical_history.family_history: Maternal grandmother had a mild form of chorea with no lifelong mental impairment; no records of hypothyroidism were documented.
